sen.j: 青山景通（あおやまかげみち、1819年（文政2年） - 1891年（明治24年）12月11日）は、幕末から明治の日本の復古神道家。
sen.e: Kagemichi AOYAMA (1819 - December 11, 1891) was a Japanese Fukko-shintoka (Reactionary Shintoist), who lived during the end of the Edo period to the Meiji period.
Kagemichi AOYAMA (1819 - December 11, 1891) was a Japanese Fukko-shintoka (Reactionary Shintoist), who lived during the end of the Edo period to the Meiji period.
Kagemichi AOYAMA (1819 - December 11, 1891) was a Japanese Fukko-shintoka (Reactionary Shintoist), who lived during the end of the Edo period to the Meiji period.
He was a lower-ranked feudal retainer in the Naeki Domain.
He was a lower-ranked feudal retainer of the Naeki clan.
sen.cmt: in→of,Domain→clan と修正しました。（人の集団の扱い）
sen.e: He was a lower-ranked feudal retainer of the Naeki clan.

sen.j: 青山直道は長男、青山胤通は三男。
sen.e: His first son was Naomichi AOYAMA, and his third son was Tanemichi AOYAMA.
Naomichi AOYAMA was his first son, and Tanemichi AOYAMA was his third son.
sen.cmt: オーダーを修正しました。
sen.e: Naomichi AOYAMA was his first son, and Tanemichi AOYAMA was his third son.

sen.j: 江戸で平田篤胤の門人となる。
sen.e: He became a disciple of Atsutane HIRATA in Edo (present Tokyo).
sen.cmt: 江戸→Edo (present Tokyo) としました。
sen.e: He became a disciple of Atsutane HIRATA in Edo (present Tokyo).
He became a disciple of Atsutane HIRATA in Edo (present Tokyo).

sen.j: 平田派国学を信奉し、他の青山一門と同様、儒教教育の否定や、藩内の寺院（藩公の菩提寺を含む）、位牌の破却を特に率先して行った。
sen.e: He supported the study of Japanese classical literature of Hirata-ha school, and as well as other members of the Aoyama family, he actively advocated the denial of Confucianism education, elimination of the Buddhist temples in the domain (including the family temple of the domain lord) and abandonment of the Buddhist mortuary tablet.
sen.cmt: 破却→eliminationと abandonment の両方を使いました。
sen.e: He supported the study of Japanese classical literature of Hirata-ha school, and as well as other members of the Aoyama family, he actively advocated the denial of the Confucian education, elimination of the Buddhist temples in the domain (including the family temple of the domain lord), and abandonment of the Buddhist mortuary tablet.
sen.cmt: Confucianism education→the Confucian education,スペースを修正しました。カンマを補いました。
sen.e: He supported the study of Japanese classical literature of Hirata-ha school, and as well as other members of the Aoyama family, he actively advocated the denial of the Confucian education, elimination of the Buddhist temples in the domain (including the family temple of the domain lord), and abandonment of the Buddhist mortuary tablet.

sen.j: そのため、強い反発を買い、元筆頭家老の千葉権右衛門、東侑之進、千葉武男、千葉鐐五郎、神山健之進、中原央、八尾伊織らが蜂起を画策するに至った。
sen.e: His approach provoked a strong backlash, and finally the former Hitto karo (the head of chief retainers) Gonemon CHIBA and other retainers such as Yunoshin HIGASHI (東侑之進), Takeo CHIBA, Ryogoro CHIBA, Kennoshin KAMIYAMA, Nakaba NAKAHARA (中原央), and Iori YAO came to plot an uprising against him.
sen.cmt: 東侑之進→正式な読み方が不明です：Yunoshin HIGASHI (東侑之進) としました。中原央→正式な読み方が不明です：Nakaba NAKAHARA (中原央) としました。
sen.e: Therefore, his approach provoked a strong backlash, and finally the former Hitto karo (the head of chief retainers) Gonemon CHIBA and other retainers such as Yunoshin HIGASHI (東侑之進), Takeo CHIBA, Ryogoro CHIBA, Kennoshin KAMIYAMA, Naka NAKAHARA, and Iori YAO came to plot an uprising against him.
sen.cmt: Therefore を補いました。「中原央＝なかはらなか」と確認し、修正しました。参照：http://www.vill.higashishirakawa.gifu.jp/archive/haibutu/035.html「東侑之進」の読みは確認出来ておりません。
sen.e: Therefore, his approach provoked a strong backlash, and finally the former Hitto karo (the head of chief retainers) Gonemon CHIBA and other retainers such as Yunoshin HIGASHI (東侑之進), Takeo CHIBA, Ryogoro CHIBA, Kennoshin KAMIYAMA, Naka NAKAHARA, and Iori YAO came to plot an uprising against him.

sen.j: だが、これを察知した青山景道は1870年(明治3年)1月12日(旧暦)に一連の共謀者を逮捕し流罪、投獄した。
sen.e: However, Kagemichi AOYAMA detected their attempt and on February 12, 1870, he arrested all co-conspirators and deported or imprisoned them.
sen.cmt: 一連の共謀者→all co-conspirators としました。
sen.e: However, Kagemichi AOYAMA detected their attempt and on February 12, 1870, he arrested all co-conspirators and exiled or imprisoned them.
However, Kagemichi AOYAMA detected their attempt and on February 12, 1870, he arrested all co-conspirators and exiled or imprisoned them.

sen.j: 1870年（明治3年）5月6日 (旧暦)に行われた国学四大人の霊祭を荻原嚴雄、三輪田元綱等と共に行う。
sen.e: He undertook the reisai (ceremony of worship) for Kokugaku no shitaijin (four giants [Azumamaro KADA, Mabuchi KAMO, Norinaga MOTOORI, and Atsutane HIRATA] of the study of Japanese classical literature) held on June 4, 1870, with Izuo OGIWARA, Mototsuna MIWADA and others.
sen.cmt: 国学四大人→定訳不明：Kokugaku no shitaijin (four giants [Azumamaro KADA, Mabuchi KAMO, Norinaga MOTOORI, and Atsutane HIRATA] of the study of Japanese classical literature) としました。霊祭→定訳不明：reisai (ceremony of worship) としました。
sen.e: He undertook the tama-matsuri (spirit festival) for Kokugaku no shitaijin (four giants [Azumamaro KADA, Mabuchi KAMO, Norinaga MOTOORI, and Atsutane HIRATA] of the study of Japanese classical literature) held on June 4, 1870, with Izuo OGIWARA, Mototsuna MIWADA and others.
sen.cmt: 「霊祭＝たままつり：spirit festivals (tama-matsuri)」と確認し、修正しました。
sen.e: He undertook the tama-matsuri (spirit festival) for Kokugaku no shitaijin (four giants [Azumamaro KADA, Mabuchi KAMO, Norinaga MOTOORI, and Atsutane HIRATA] of the study of Japanese classical literature) held on June 4, 1870, with Izuo OGIWARA, Mototsuna MIWADA and others.

sen.j: 王政復古期の改革で子の直道とともに重要な役割を担った。
sen.e: He played an important role together with his son Naomichi in the reform during the restoration process of Imperial rule.

sen.e: He played an important role together with his son Naomichi, in the reform during the restoration process of the imperial rule.
He also transcribed "Keizaisoron" (general theory of economics) by hand.

sen.j: 1859年（安政6年）5月15日 (旧暦) 江戸麻布で胤通生まる。

sen.e: In June 1868, he was recruited by the restoration government, and appointed Choshi (selected capable official in charge of deliberative proceedings) and Jingikan (officer of the institution for dedicating to religious ceremony) gonhanji (assistant judicial officer).

sen.e: In 1876, Aoyama's residence was set on fire by the people who felt frustrated by Haibutsu-kishaku (the anti-Buddhist movement at the beginning of the Meiji era).
